premise: In the ancestral environment a man would be likely to have more offspring if he got his pick of the most fertile-seeming women.
label: contradiction

premise: [W]e have a book worthy of its subject--graceful, astonishingly well researched, yet imbued with a sense of flow that is rarely achieved at this level of scholarship, says Daphne Merkin in the New York Times Book Review . (See Sarah Kerr's review in Slate.)
